answers.answer: Concerned,Sorry it's taken a few days to provide an answer.  We're volunteers here and not medical professionals, so while we have a lot of experience with diabetes, do check out what you read with your doc.I hope that you will contact your physician soon and get a complete physical along with screen blood/urine tests.  Some of the symptoms you describe (thirst, urination) are associated with elevated blood sugar, but thirst can be a marker of other things, too.  If a person drinks a gallon or more water a day, it is also necessary to excrete the excess ... thru urine .. in order to maintain fluid balances.There can be imbalances not related to diabetes that contribute to your symptoms.The tingling & numbness are sometimes symptoms of low blood sugar and can also indicate other things -- a pinches nerve, musculo-skeletal misalignment, etc.I suppose that the bottom line here is that your set of symptoms is worth discussing with your doctor, as you continue to keep good records of what you're experiencing when.  Good luck.

question: I am writing because lately I have been experiencing some problems that just have seem to hit me.About 4 months ago I started to experience some lightheadedness.  It would come and go but now seems to stay with me.  I feel better after I eat but not great.  What is considered excessive urination.  I drink alot of water during the day..maybe 1 to 1.5 gallons of water.  My mouth does not feel very dry but I feel thirsty and I can't go more than 1 to 2 hours without going to the bathroom.  Is this considered extreme?  Some days I may go a few hours but not usually.  At night it depends.  I usually get up at least once but it usually goes..10:30 or 11..3 or 3:30am and then again when I get up.I have had some slight tignling in my hands and feet but and they seem to fall asleep a little more easily but the feeling I get is one when you foot has fallen asleep and then it feels like a bunch of needles pricking you when it is waking back up.  It is only a faint feeling but it happens.  I have also had some slight tingling in the face and lips.  I also have a white coating on the back of my tongue.  You can only see it if I stick my tognue out all the way.  I asked my allergist about this and said it was normal buildup and to just brush it which it seems to go away when I brush but is there at the end of the day.I am 29 and will be 30 very soon.  I am about 5'9" and weigh about 185.  I maybe have lost some weight but I always gain it back.  When I say lost I may have a small fluctuation in weight which may be from 3 to 7 pounds.  Any help or feedback would be appreciated
title: Are everyone's symptoms the same?
